intro: Lysimachia longshengensis, commonly known as the Longsheng yellowjacket, is a species of flowering plant in the family Primulaceae. It is native to China, specifically the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, where it thrives in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It is often found in rocky or mountainous areas, preferring cool and humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
